markdown:
No one is quite sure what lesser deaths are, though some claim that they are avatars of the grim reaper. Unlike that strange hunter, however, lesser deaths hunt in packs on rare occasions. More often than not, they manifest from cursed magic items. Other times, they are just the enactors of death, hunting in the same way the grim reaper does— silently, with neither remorse nor quarter. Rarely, multiple lesser deaths work together to cull a large population, their scythes cutting through crowds and leaving entire cities devoid of life, inspiring (hopefully) false rumors of multiple grim reapers. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 40 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35 [Lesser Death](/Monsters.aspx?ID=251) **Source** [Bestiary](/Sources.aspx?ID=2) pg. 197 **Perception** +32; darkvision, [_see invisibility_](/Spells.aspx?ID=271), status sight, [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +33, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +28, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +30, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +32, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +30, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +26, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +35 **Str** +6 **Dex** +9 **Con** +6 **Int** +4 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +6 **Death’s Grace** The lesser death can choose whether or not it counts as undead for effects that affect undead differently. Even if it does not count as undead, the lesser death still never counts as a living creature.
**Status Sight** The lesser death automatically knows the Hit Points, conditions, afflictions, and emotions of all creatures it can see. **Items** [Scythe](/Weapons.aspx?ID=39) --- **AC** 39 **Fort** +30 **Ref** +33 **Will** +32 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 255 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, unconscious **Aura of Misfortune** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=110)) 20 feet. Living creatures in the aura must roll twice on all d20 rolls and use the lower result.
**Negative Healing** The lesser death can choose whether or not it takes positive damage.
**Lurking Death** ([teleportation](/Traits.aspx?ID=156)); **Trigger** A creature within 60 feet makes a ranged attack or uses an action that has the concentrate, manipulate, or move trait. **Effect** The lesser death teleports to a square adjacent to the triggering creature and makes a melee Strike against it. If the Strike hits, the lesser death disrupts the triggering action. --- **Speed** 50 feet, fly 40 feet **Melee** _keen scythe_ +32 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [deadly 2d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)), **Damage** 3d10+14 slashing plus 1d12 negative **Divine Innate Spells** DC 38 - **Constant (2nd)** [See Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=271) - **Constant (3rd)** [Haste](/Spells.aspx?ID=147) - **Constant (6th)** [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Infuse Weapon** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65)) Any scythe gains the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170) trait, can’t be disarmed, and becomes a _[+2 greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [keen](/Equipment.aspx?ID=300) scythe_ while the lesser death wields it.
